website_summaries.verdict: The smaller 8-inch Windows 8 tablet is a form worth exploring, and the Acer Iconia W3 can be fun to use, but it's also buggy and held back by shortcuts and lackluster features.
pros: Parts of the Windows 8 experience work surprisingly well in the Acer Iconia W3, which is a smaller 8-inch tablet
The carry-along keyboard is clever, and battery life is excellent for a non-Haswell system
cons: Outside of tile-based Windows 8 apps, navigation is a pain
Screen quality is exceptionally poor, and the keyboard dock lacks a touch pad or even a track point

customer_reviews.title: An interesting tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first windows tablet, and I must say I am very conflicted. The tablet itself is interesting and it is fun to have a full version of windows that you can carry around whenever, but from such a known company the quality of the build is terrible along with the screen. Windows lags a lot on this device and battery life is not the best. On the positive side it is a small cheap solution to have in your pocket, but with all the choices out there today I would try another first.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: I'd give it 5 star if I can fix the bluetooth connection problem
customer_reviews.text: I had to send it to Texas Because The Battery Needed Replacing But Customer Service Was Wonderful It Was Fully Paid For Then I Had Another Issue When I Downloaded Window 8.1 included with the tablet I had a driver issue I contacted customer service again and they helped me fix this problem The text on apps weren't displaying just blacked out lines I'm having Two more issues to work out My bluetooth device is not connecting to my mobilie keyboard and my wireless printer needs the USB to work this might be my fault I might Of installed it wrong Make Sure you get the USB Connector When You Order The Acer Iconia You Will Need it
customer_reviews.author: Debra Green

customer_reviews.title: Very Good!
customer_reviews.text: Recieved Acer before the date given. The product was bran new and worked great. Set up was easy. The only thing I had trouble with was getting used to windows 8. Tablet froze on me a few times when i was in the app store but a reboot or waiting a few minutes it did fix itself but what do you except this is a tablet not a bran new high speed computer. But i really do love the tablet. Works great and is very portable and light. They are micro ports which i did not read carfully enough incase you are looking for a keyboard or anything to go along with it!
customer_reviews.author: Denaye

customer_reviews.title: Well-worth the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: OK, I've had this tablet since early September, and after reading so many negative reviews, I felt I just HAD to put my 2 cents worth in. I bought it when it was on sale for $299.99, and a few weeks later I was also able to purchase the Bluetooth physical keyboard that goes with it for $25.00. Together, they totally meet my needs for a Windows-based tablet that comes with Office installed. For me, the screen resolution is just fine--I have a Kindle HD if I want to watch movies. I mainly use it for word-processing, checking e-mail and Facebook, and it meets my needs just fine, at a price that I found extremely reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dunk

customer_reviews.title: nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: bought to upgrade my blackberry playbook, and a nice upgrade. more features, good battery life, and not too much bigger. overall happy with the unit with the only concern being the screen. I have had many other tablets, low end and higher end, including the Lenovo thinkpad tablet 2, and the acer screen is a little funny. seems a tad glossy in a weird way, I think its just a cheaper screen than my Lenovo?? so be weary, some cant stand it, others don't notice. other than that, good product so far. had to get the keyboard for upper level college!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: joecool

customer_reviews.title: Great deal at $299
customer_reviews.text: The upside of all those negative reviews is that Acer is clearing out the old stock to make way for the new W4 - which will sell for close to $500 - so the W3 is a great bargain. Could the screen be better? Sure but it's not really that bad - more than adequate in normal room light - just don't try it in bright sunlight but that's also the case for even the iPad. It's fast and versatile. I was able to load an old version of PhotoShop 7.01 and the software for my old Sony LocationFree box so I can stream my cable box to the W3 anywhere in the world with a Wi-Fi connection.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd123

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. I did not think I would like a windows tablet but needed one for work. I am blown away at how much I love it. Acer did an awesome job. I fits my hand so I can handle it with ease. I have not found any problems. I can print through my office network which saves time. I am so impressed with this Acer Iconia that I bought a second one as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: No Microsoft Office!!!
customer_reviews.text: FALSE ADVERTISING! this tablet DOES NOT come with Microsoft Office. When I clicked on the Office icon, I was prompted to buy MS Office or to activate a free trial of Office 360. Microsoft Office Home & Student was not installed as the product information and the packaging claim. I contacted Acer and was told that only the trial version is included. The product information should be updated to say that this tablet does not have any productivity software which is not included with Windows 8. I gave 2 stars (instead of 1) because after paying for MS Office separately, the hardware does a good job of running it. It works especially nice with the bluetooth keyboard (ordered separately).
customer_reviews.author: Mesix

customer_reviews.title: Small and user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for a netbook I use for ambulance use. I've had it one week and am loving it. I feel guilty because I use it more than my daily laptop which has served me faithfully for years. Learning windows 8 took a little playing with, but it's not too difficult to do. I would dig a full size USB port rather than the micro USB or both.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S. Druge

customer_reviews.title: Avoid it at all costs
customer_reviews.text: + Great Battery + Small - Worst tab screen you will ever use in your life. Stay away - Tacky build quality - Too small to be usable with full windows apps, trust me ? Questionable performance even for every-day use As a side note, the keyboard attachment was pricey and complete rubbish
customer_reviews.author: DrWaSaBe

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I use this tablet for everything, It charges fast, and lasts a long time, I can read and play games surf the web and use it for my office needs. There are a lot of apps that come with this tablet. I have yet to use them all.
customer_reviews.author: LittleMiss

customer_reviews.title: great price and very useful
customer_reviews.text: i've been using this tablet pc for about 4 months and i can tell you that if you get this for 140 o less its a steal i got mine at 130 and dude, came with office and onedrive subscription and i don't mean office 365 I mean real h&s office wich is awesome, yeah the screen its not the beast but use this tablets for keynotes which is why i bought it, and i gptta say that is been a really amazing experoence for the buck, you can't expect tha power of maybe a surface prp o even an ipad but dude its simple amazing for the price
customer_reviews.author: omar zamudio

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty cool.
customer_reviews.text: For a small tablet, it works well with office apps, video streaming, web browsing. Links easily with a bluetooth keyboard. Would be perfect to have on the road, as long as wi-fi was available. Unfortunately, the USB port is really for the purpose of powering other USB devices, not for charging (have to use Acer's proprietary charger).
customer_reviews.author: Waldo Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money but for a Windows tablet 64 GB ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money but for a Windows tablet 64 GB isn't enough as most is used for the OS and Office once installed. It does have a USB drive capability so you do have the option of additional storage BUT don't try installing programs on the removable drive.
customer_reviews.author: EDWARD ODANIEL

customer_reviews.title: Great small tablet that runs regular Win 8.
customer_reviews.text: Since it uses the Intel Atom cpu inside, it has the capabilities of the regular Windows 8 laptop. If you are not doing high intensive graphics, this is the tablet to get.I use this to keep track of my business. I am able to install regular printer drivers to print wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Lee

customer_reviews.title: Beginner tablet
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the 32gb. I use it mainly for gaming, which is ok. It is a nice beginner tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Windows 8.1 in the palm of your hand!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing to have full version of Windows 8 in such a lightweight and portable device. Hardware is more than capable of handling the OS. Have had no issues at all. It handled the upgrade to 8.1 flawlessly. Very happy with this purchase and would recommend highly. I use it every day, am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 6 mths ago and i really dont like it.. gave trouble i had to send it back to acer to fix... when it came back it just lags and moves slow i should have bought a cheap android tablet... Dont buy this.. it needs better specs
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: I use it often and like the ease of use and the fact that it ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a higher rating except it goes to sleep and by the time I get it to work again the battery dies. I use it often and like the ease of use and the fact that it is small enough to fit into my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Gipson

customer_reviews.title: Great product & business
customer_reviews.text: I had a small issue with my Acer and the business owner worked with me and totally fixed the problem. He (Luis) was very professional and friendly. 5 stars all the way. Thanks Luis, Karen L. Gullion
customer_reviews.author: karenl65

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything that my (much more tech savvy) boyfriend's Surface does on a daily basis - for a quarter of the price. Works great as a reader or to download and run stats programs in a graduate class. I just wish it came with a nice pen. I can't seem to find one... I bought the warranty through Amazon as well. I've slept like a baby since.
customer_reviews.author: Aubree W.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Screen!
customer_reviews.text: While the size and speed were good, it has a horrible display. The text appears blurry, like a cheap screen protector was still attached, but there wasn't one, I had already removed it! I ended up getting the ASUS Transformer Book T100. Much better!
customer_reviews.author: AJ808

customer_reviews.title: Awsome little tablet
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered had a problem with the right side of the screen, but my replacement works Great, it does everything a P.C does except no disk drive obviously, very cool tablet
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: S l o  o o w
customer_reviews.text: Well built and feels nice but the screen is kinda bad and it's slow but it's also a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: nice product but not enough hard drive space
customer_reviews.text: great product but returned it because the 32 gb version was just too small. after updates i had about 8 gb left to play with and had a hard time making the sd card default for anything.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: This little power house is more than I expected and well worth what paid for it feel awkward at first but once set it up you are good go. vcccdog
customer_reviews.author: Bob D Weakley

customer_reviews.title: acer iconia
customer_reviews.text: for the size 8 inch sure does well work great
customer_reviews.author: daniel collins

customer_reviews.title: Not as responsive as some
customer_reviews.text: this tablet just isn't as responsive as say the Microsoft Surface or some others. Aside from that I do like being able to carry my win8 system to work as a mobile office
customer_reviews.author: debrasue

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen does not work
customer_reviews.text: It works great with a keyboard and a mouse. But the touch screen worked off and on. I even upgraded to Windows 8.1 and the touch screen worked for a week but not now. I use it for Word Excel and PowerPoint on the plane to do my work. I called the ACER call center and they said to reset it. Well I've reset it about 20 times and the touch screen still doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B

customer_reviews.title: Best Tablet Option
customer_reviews.text: Has all the features of a desktop and very portable. Great buy! Wish they made a case that would hold the tablet & keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: RSVPAR

customer_reviews.title: Iconia computer
customer_reviews.text: Love the Iconia use it on a daily basis. Carry it with me all the time. Except for the adapter problem I am very happy I purchased it
customer_reviews.author: Fred Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet except for limited screen view angles
customer_reviews.text: Love the tablet (except the screens limited view angles - but not a deal breaker for me). Full Windows 8 on an 8.1 inch tablet, very responsive performance, micro SDXC (64GB), micro USB, all day battery life and free Microsoft Office (just Activate it with the included Authorization Code)... Nice! (Review written on this tablet with an Acer bluetooth keyboard and Börnd bluetooth mouse).
customer_reviews.author: J. Tankersley

customer_reviews.title: problems
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned this product a short time but wouldn't recommend it as it started giving me problems. It freezes while using it, and then doesn't start. It offers an option for troubleshooting, but when u go to select this option it again freezes up.
customer_reviews.author: john bergin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: When you get a tablet that has full windows you hope to use it like a full computer. That would be the case if it had a full USB.
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer4Life

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet PC for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Windows 8 Tablet for the price. I have no complaints. I have read some negative remarks about the display. I am well pleased. I have no problems with the display.
customer_reviews.author: DMac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Way better than expected , good enough that I bought another one for my wife
customer_reviews.author: Bush Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a company promo.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tablet, purchased about a dozen or so and had to return 3 for bad power supply problem. Thank you

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it so much! Its very easy to use. Super lightweight and compact. Only downside is the camera kinda sucks its only 2mp but if you mostly want it for school like me its perfect and I totally recommend it 😊
customer_reviews.author: SamSoCali

customer_reviews.title: Good for young eyes
customer_reviews.text: Wish Acer had larger units - 10" would be great! 8" isn't big enough for those of us with bifocals
customer_reviews.author: E. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet for your money
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is the best windows 8 tablet I have tried. Battery lasts for about 7.5 hours playing movies. About 8 hours playing games and surfing the web. It surprised me when it could handle larger files and run high memory using programs.
customer_reviews.author: techie

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I normally never review a product. However, this is the worst electronic purchase I have ever made. The touch screen is useless without the stylus. Almost useless with the stylus. I could go on and on. Slow too.
customer_reviews.author: JMP (Baraboo WI)

customer_reviews.title: nice tablet, but poor dealer
customer_reviews.text: the dealer's ad said that there was a 14-day return policy. What the ad did not say was that there was a 10% restocking fee. That was, in my mind, deceptive advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Solomon

customer_reviews.title: I would return it if I could!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could return it I would, but waited to long. It ran really good for a month and now the screen messes up, it won't see the keyboard anymore, hangs up when I turn it on. Really was happy with it when I first got it, It played Flash great and I do a lot of reading. I think I just wasted $350.00, I have the Kindle fire which I loved, except it wouldn't play Flash.
customer_reviews.author: PopsTheGnome

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I returned the tablet it did not work. Waiting for my money to be refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Solusanya

customer_reviews.title: less than 2-months of use... won't boot!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this little tablet when it was working. It started much faster than my laptop so for quickly checking something online it was great. Now I get to see how well the Acer customer service works. Even at $300, I expected several years of use without needing service, but after only two months of light use it suddenly stopped booting. Quite a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G

customer_reviews.title: Not at all, it came with an user and ...
customer_reviews.text: Not at all, it came with an user and a password. And the battery is dead so, it was a complete disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Nebulousb

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Handy device. Fast but screen not as crisp as more recent tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it goof
customer_reviews.text: I came in broken but I still got my money back
customer_reviews.author: radix

customer_reviews.title: perfect for simple tasas
customer_reviews.text: I don`t really use PC`s, but for some tasks, it it perfect and portable. It has more power than expected.
customer_reviews.author: DrSanchez

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a good start
customer_reviews.text: Good for factoring abit chunky...fast enough and unique compared to ios to have real windows in this size...and haven't work well.. But the screen is a disaster and takes 2 stars. There are similar form factor, faster devices with much better screens at a similar price point now.
customer_reviews.author: Aphonic

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I like it lots of things to do on it & very easy to use. It's small enough to fit in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: raerush1

customer_reviews.title: Battery would not take a charge. I sent it ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery would not take a charge. I sent it back the manufacturers for repair and when I got it back it still would not take a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: i like it
customer_reviews.text: I like my tablet. It is very useful. The screen is bright and colorful. The storage isn't all that great though...overall a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jaylon Owens

customer_reviews.title: very good tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and good tablet U can take it any where and community all friends I love this tablet Nice
customer_reviews.author: Alqallaf

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: After using the second one for about 6 weeks, it completely stopped working...died. The first one did not work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gus Meuli

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Unit!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is used pretty intensively, hooked up to HDMI 32 inch tv, runs wireless mouse and keyboard, used to for email, processing databases, coding, etc. Its awesome! It runs faster than expected given its processor however it is dependable and is really a great bargain for the money. Now to find a decent tab cover for it so we can take it out into the field! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DKM Integrated Software Solutions LLC

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: if you read the other post about the device you will see they pretty accurate. nice form factor, lousy screen resolution. speakers are not so good even for a tablet. windows ...well windows is windows
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking hardware but doesn't turn on.
customer_reviews.text: I think the hardware feels pretty nice but unfortunately the tablet won't turn on. I was hoping the screen wasn't as bad as everyone says but I guess I'll never know. I am returning this and I certainly wouldn't buy the updated version of this tablet that is supposed to come out soon. Don't buy this tablet. Wait till the Lenovo Miix 8 or the Dell Venue 8 come out. Your going to want an IPS display not whatever this display is. I find it funny how they tried to price this originally like an iPad, its laughable to think that people would buy this over an iPad considering the screen is taken from Fisher Price. Shame on you Acer.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grand daughter for Christmas. It won't turn on and Amazon says it can't be returned because it was purchased in September. This sucks. Guess I should have went to staples. Live and Learn.
customer_reviews.author: sped

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: $350. For a 64 gig little tablet is great. Screen not perfect but good enough head to head with my iPad mink and its about the same. I went head to head with the same music video and I could see pimples on the singers face that can't be see on the mini. I can play on my chess site and am learning Spanish on it. So it fits my needs
customer_reviews.author: G. L my name

customer_reviews.title: dont be fooled by the price
customer_reviews.text: don't let the price fool you. this table kicks major butt. it updated to windows 8.1 very smoothly. runs as fast as my wifes expensive tablet
customer_reviews.author: Jorge S.

customer_reviews.title: Very basic
customer_reviews.text: Are ideal for basic work, but dont come with microusb adapter, The plastic feel cheap, but if you want a tablet with run all your pc programs, this device are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Quezada

customer_reviews.title: Is it the tablet or windows 8.1 the issue???
customer_reviews.text: Need a tablet or laptop to connect with work emails, work interface. Worked fine till 8.1 windows update. Then nothing. If I had windows 7, things would work perfect, but no, they won't let that happen! I despise the windows 8 operating system......remember windows vista?? Same issues if not worse. And who is going to fix these issues.......NO ONE!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: horrible screen imaging
customer_reviews.text: This item has a terrible screen. When switching screens, the image of the previous screen is in the background for quite a while before fading....same thing when watching a video. Extremely annoying and not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: julie krebser

customer_reviews.title: Unable to view or hear video or audio requiring Flash Player
customer_reviews.text: I was advised that as this runs on Windows 8 operating system(not by the seller l hasten to add), video and audio that requires Flash player would play on this tablet which is why I specifically bought it, unfortunately I was unable to make this happen.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what i was looking for as a gift. The person who got the tablet loves it. No Office 2013 included!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wimer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable full computer tablet, it gets my work done
customer_reviews.text: Found this video on YouTube w3 in action. No need write my opinion. Just watching video shows how fast and fluid and full computer that can get your work done. Goto and watch videos. Makes iPad toy and laggy android fail. YouTube.com/thewebmogul
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is wonderful! Light weight and easy to hold. I use this tablet and my IPad mini and all my other gadgets are gathering dust!
customer_reviews.author: LouM

customer_reviews.title: acer doe not want my buseness
customer_reviews.text: I could not register the tablet Aver wanted me to purchase a warranty for 139.00 dollars just to use the tablet Why did I pay 279.00 at first!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: puceron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the kids!
customer_reviews.text: easy for them to use and small for there hands to carry around. It does run on a atom chip, but I expected that. Battery life hasn't been too bad for it's price point. I am a windows fan, so keep bringing those small tablets. good start for Microsoft!
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: Bad touch display
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews have said the range of view is weak compared to other tablets. I did not have a complaint about brightness. However, had responsive issues with touch display. And the display cracked while double clicking and I ended up with glass pieces on my index finger. A good tablet in concept. Execution is very weak. Product quality could use some very needed improvements.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Good inside, bad presentation
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality of the screen, it spoils overall impression of this not bad device. Can't use it keeping my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: PAVEL SHEVCHOUK

customer_reviews.title: one day uncle Jeb and I were hunting for some food and up came bubbling crude
customer_reviews.text: That thing is harder to operate than teaching a Cat algebra. And it's slower than grandma and she was slow. Real slow. So I sent er back. Got my money back and bought me some lotto tickets. I'm a gazllionair now. And I bought that there computer company and turned it into a commune for hippies. Man the world is a funny place. All hail Amazon From whom All internet blessings flow. AMAZON
customer_reviews.author: pen name

customer_reviews.title: Will not even power on
customer_reviews.text: The device will not power on. The power charging light flashes intermittently. I called Acer. They said it is a faulty unit. Apparently they do not even check the unit because it has no charge at all. He said it should boot up without charging it at least once. I would recommend finding another company to do business with. This left me in a bad spot since I am traveling and now have to lug 2 laptops with me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: disappointed: device refuse to charge
customer_reviews.text: I always have the message: 'not charging'. It works only when plugged in. May be an hardware failure, more probably a BIOS problem. Anyway, the device is useless. They made a cheap product, and you get what you paid for. No quality control at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Client Amazon

customer_reviews.title: very good size.
customer_reviews.text: acer iconia w3-810 is good design, weight, size but screen is not good. but the only 8.1" tablet...... I bought.
customer_reviews.author: joygram

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this
customer_reviews.text: The screen display on this is absolutely horrible....I mean ABSOLUTELY. I couldn't play with this more than 5 minutes before deciding to return it. I'm a Windows guy and can't wait for someone to come out with a decent tablet
customer_reviews.author: DDinTX

customer_reviews.title: screen is very very very bad!!
customer_reviews.text: The screen is too bad, permeability is poor, looks hazy. When the machine is running ,the place near the camera is easy to burning hot。
customer_reviews.author: hanyi ye

customer_reviews.title: awful
customer_reviews.text: this is the worst tablet I have ever purchased from amazon wi fi worked for a day then it stopped working after 2 days I returned it no wi fi no internet access only got 2 bars
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: I love my Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is the second of the series I have owned. The first I forgot on the top of my car while rushing to a client and it did not survive being run over by a cement truck. But this one has been a life saver as I use it daily for client assignments. It is almost an extension of my arm. Running Windows Pro 8.1 flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Smith

product_meta.title: Acer Iconia W3-810-1600 8.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Size:32 GBAcer Iconia W3-810-1600 Tablet comes with these high level Specs: Intel Atom Dual-Core Processor Z2760, Windows 8, 8.1" HD 1280 x 800 resolution high-brightness (300-nit) Acer CrystalBrite LED-backlit TFT LCD, 5-Point multi-touch screen, supporting finger touch and image auto rotation, Intel Graphics Media Accelerator with 64MB of dedicated system memory, High-definition audio support, 2048MB of LPDDR2 800 MHz Onboard memory chip support , 32GB Internal Storage, 802.11a/b/g/n Wireless, Bluetooth 4.0+EDR, 2MP Rear-facing camera, 2MP Front-facing camera, 1 - Micro USB 2.0 Port, 1 - Micro-HDMI with HDCP support, 2-Cell Li-Polymer (3500 mAh) Battery, Up to 8-hours Battery Life, 1.1 lbs. - 0.50 kg (tablet only), Microsoft Office Home and Student 2013

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Intel Atom Dual-Core Processor Z2760 - 1.5 GHz (1 MB Cache)
32 GB Flash Memory, 2 GB RAM Memory
8-hour battery life, 1.1 pounds. For battery replacement & warranty issue-Please contact the Acer Warranty department

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.5 out of 5 stars226 ratings2.5 out of 5 stars
